statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description:
Keydren Clark scored 29 points to lead St.
Peter's to an 84-74 win over Manhattan College Sunday night in the
Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference semifinals.
article.headline: Clark nets 29 as St. Peter's upends Manhattan in MAAC
article.linkText: Clark nets 29 as St. Peter's upends Manhattan in MAAC

article.story:
ALBANY, N.Y. (AP) -- Keydren Clark scored 29 points to lead St. Peter's to an 84-74 win over Manhattan College Sunday night in the Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference semifinals.

Raul Orta scored 18 while Todd Sowell had 10 points and eight rebounds for the Peacocks (16-14), who advanced to their first MAAC championship since 1999 and their first under sixth-year coach Bob Leckie.

St. Peter's will face the winner of Iona vs. Marist in the tournament's other semifinal.

Arturo Dubois scored 24 points and had nine rebounds for the Jaspers (18-9), who entered the tournament as the top seed.

St. Peter's took the lead from Manhattan 24 seconds into the second half on Kevin Spann's four-point play, making the score 43-41. The Peacocks never looked back and built an 11-point lead in the first five minutes, 56-45.

Manhattan failed to score a field goal in the final three minutes after closing to within four points, 78-74, on Dubois' turnaround six-foot jumper.

St. Peter's last won the tournament title in 1995, beating Manhattan in overtime.
